IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: ACUTE CARE HOSPITAL, NURSING HOME, AND HOME HEALTH AGENCY
IRS990.MissionDesc: ACUTE CARE HOSPITAL, NURSING HOME, AND HOME HEALTH AGENCY
IRS990.Desc: OZARK HEALTH, INC. IS AN ACUTE CARE FACILITY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MANAGEMENT ANNUALLY REVIEWS ITS TAX POSITION AND HAS DETERMINED THERE ARE NO MATERIAL UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT REQUIRE RECOGNITION IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS

SupplementalInformationGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Facility: - Part V, Section B, Line 5

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part III, Line 9b - Provisions On Collection Practices For Qualified Patients
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PATIENTS ARE INFORMED OF CHARITY CARE PROGRAM
UTILIZES ANNUAL STATISTICAL REPORT WITH DEMOGRAPHIC INFORMATION FROM DHS AS WELL AS REPORTS SHOWING PERCENT OF ACTIVITY OF COMMUNITY BY PAYOR SOURCE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part VI, Line 3 - Patient Education of Eligibility for Assistance
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: INFORMS PATIENTS UPON ADMISSION AND POSTS NOTICES IN CONSPICUOUS AREAS.
RURAL SETTING, PREDOMINANTLY AGRICULTURAL BASE. AVERAGE INCOME AT OR BELOW FEDERAL POVERTY GUIDELINES, PREDOMINANTLY CAUCASIAN, HIGH SCHOOL EDUCATED AND GERIATRIC IN NATURE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part VI, Line 5 - Promotion of Community Health
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: OPEN MEDICAL STAFF, ANNUAL HEALTH FAIR HELD FOR THE COMMUNITY, CAR SEAT AND HELMET PROGRAM FOR THE COMMUNITY, AND A FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM TO HELP THE COMMUNITY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER REVIEWS 990 PRIOR TO SIGNING FORM 8879-EO TO APPROVE ELECTRONIC FILING. BOARD REVIEWS UPON REQUEST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EACH BOARD MEMBER, PRINCIPAL OFFICER, MEMBER OF A COMMITTEE WITH BOARD DELEGATED POWERS, DIRECTOR OR MANAGER ANNUALLY SIGNS A STATEMENT AFFIRMING COMPLIANCE WITH THE POLICY. IF A CONFLICT OF INTEREST IS DISCLOSED THE DISINTERESTED BOARD MEMBERS PERFORM DUE DILIGENCE AND DETERMINE BY A MAJORITY VOTE WHETHER THE TRANSACTION OR ARRANGEMENT IS IN THE HOSPITAL'S BEST INTEREST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE HOSPITAL BOARD EVALUATES THE CEO'S PERFORMANCE AND APPROVES COMPENSATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CEO EVALUATES AND APPROVES COMPENSATION FOR THE OTHER DIRECTORS AND MANAGEERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EMPLOYEE RECORDS ARE RETAINED IN PERPETUITY. ACCOUNTS PAYABLE RECORDS ARE RETAINED FOR FIVE YEARS.

IdRelatedTaxExemptOrgGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: PROVIDE ASSISTANCE AND FURTHER THE PURPO
